head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Staten Island: New Reptile Wing

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Staten Island: New Reptile Wing

block.p: City officials yesterday opened the refurbished reptile wing at the Staten Island Zoo. The city invested $18.8 million in the 16,600-square-foot wing, which has a two-level alligator pool and 120 species of reptiles. Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said the zoo was home to one of the largest collections of venomous reptiles in the country. The mayor also said that the renovation incorporated energy-efficient features to allow the zoo to cut energy consumption by 20 percent.
